headline: Don’t Call This Old Nirbhaya Helpline Going Viral After Hyd Case
fact_check_details: This number is now defunct. It was launched in 2015 by the Mumbai Railway Police, and closed in 2018.

headline: No, This Isn’t the Italian President Crying Over COVID-19 Deaths
fact_check_details: The image is of Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro who broke down at a thanksgiving service in December 2019.

headline: Images of Detention Camps in US, La Romana Shared as Assam Camps
fact_check_details: The images circulating online are not of a detention camp in Assam. In fact, they are not even from India.

headline: Dettol Products Work Against Novel Coronavirus? Here’s The Truth
fact_check_details: Viral images  on social media claim that Dettol products are effective against novel coronavirus.

headline: RSS Workers Burning the Constitution? No, Video Is Old & Unrelated
fact_check_details: A video with a claim that RSS people are burning the constitution is viral, but the video is old and unrelated.

headline: Did Manmohan Singh Change His Stance on CAB? Here’s A Fact-Check
fact_check_details: Right-wing websites and BJP IT Cell Chief Amit Malviya are claiming that Dr Singh supported Citizenship Bill in 2003

headline: JNU Girls Abusing on Campus? Video Is Neither Recent Nor From JNU
fact_check_details: A false video from XLRI, Jamshedpur is being shared with a claim calling for shutdown of JNU.

headline: Photo of Couple at Airport Shared as Italian Doctors' Last Moments
fact_check_details: The couple was spotted and clicked by an Associated Press (AP) photographer Emilio Morenatti nearly two weeks ago.

headline: Old Image Shared as CAA Protestors Vandalising Amar Jawan Memorial
fact_check_details: The picture is from 2012 when some protestors had vandalised Amar Jawan Jyoti memorial near CST in Mumbai.

headline: Fake Communal Tweet Shared in the Name of AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan
fact_check_details: While Khan had tweeted about the leads at noon, he had nowhere referred to Shaheen Bagh or Islam in his tweet.

headline: Italy Lockdown: No, Photos of Dolphins & Swans Are Not From Venice
fact_check_details: The pictures of swans is from Burano, which is a small island in the Venice metropolitan area.

headline: ‘Chhapaak’ Acid Attacker’s Religion Changed? Swarajya Got It Wrong
fact_check_details: Reviewers who have watched the movie have confirmed that the religion of the acid attacker is unchanged.

headline: Mohandas Pai Tweets Photo of Indira Gandhi at JNU With Fake Claim
fact_check_details: According to the photo, Indira Gandhi brought police to JNU & beat up Yechury for protesting against the Emergency.

headline: OpIndia Runs Fake News On Muslims Refusing to Be Tested in K’taka
fact_check_details: Deputy commissioner of Uttara Kannada said that neither him nor his officials have conveyed any such information.

headline: No, That’s Not a ‘Demon’ in Italy – It’s a Digital Creation
fact_check_details: The video shows a digitally created structure and not a demon.

headline: Saint Found Alive in TN After 300 Years? No, That’s a False Claim
fact_check_details: The video shows a man, identified as Alexander, receiving treatment for a skin disease called psoriasis.

headline: Jaffrabad Shooter Was Identified as Shahrukh, Not Anurag Mishra
fact_check_details: The man who fired eight rounds in Delhi’s Jaffrabad area on Monday, 24 February was identified as Shahrukh.

headline: Tigers Engulfed in Flames of Australian Bushfires? No, Think Again
fact_check_details: Some of the wildly viral photos are not from the bushfires, but have been misappropriated from unrelated incidents.

headline: Old Video Shared as Chinese PM Praying Amid Coronavirus Scare
fact_check_details: The video is almost four years old and shows the Malaysian PM offering prayers at a mosque in China.

headline: Trump’s Pinocchio Moments: 10 Times US Prez Spread Disinformation
fact_check_details: Ahead of Trump’s India visit, here’s a look at 10 instances when the US president was caught sharing disinformation.

headline: Amit Shah Touching Nithyananda’s Feet? Nope, Look Again
fact_check_details: The face of the man bending in the photo to touch Nithyananda’s feet is largely concealed by the latter’s hands.

headline: Message on Coronavirus (COVID-19) Neither From UNICEF Nor Accurate
fact_check_details: A message attributed to UNICEF with misleading claims related to the  coronavirus is being shared on social media.

headline: ‘Pakistan Zindabad’ Slogans Raised at Lucknow Protests? Fake Alert
fact_check_details: Amit Malviya shared a video with a claim that “Pakistan Zindabad” slogans were raised at CAA protests in Lucknow.

headline: Muslims Chanting Azadi from Rahul Gandhi Slogans? Here’s The Truth
fact_check_details: The viral video that claims freedom from opposition leaders is misleading and an old video published in May 2019.

headline: Edited Photo Abusing Hindus Shared to Discredit CAA Protests
fact_check_details: The edited picture crops the poster from the centre to create a false impression.

headline: ‘Reality of Shaheen Bagh’: Videos Shared With Fake Claims Go Viral
fact_check_details: A set of images are circulating with the claim that truth of women sitting in the protest of Shaheen Bagh is busted.

headline: COVID-19: Blanket Holidays Declared In 4 States? Fake Alert!
fact_check_details: Sources in the Health Ministry have confirmed to The Quint that the circular has not been issued by the ministry.

headline: Sunny Deol’s Movie Clip Shared With False ‘Jihadi Education’ Spin
fact_check_details: The video is being shared out of context and has been clipped from a 2019 feature film ‘Blank’.

headline: Here’s Your Round-Up of All the Fake News Around CAA Protests
fact_check_details: The Quint’s WebQoof has identified and debunked at least nine fake news stories in the past five days.

headline: No Proof To Suggest ‘Coronil Drops’  Cure Coronavirus (COVID-19)
fact_check_details: “I will not recommend this medicine, considering that nothing is known about its composition,” Dr Manpreet said.

headline: Video of Pak Street Vendor Painting Fruits Shared with False Claim
fact_check_details: The video is from Pakistan’s Afzalpur where a fruit vendor was caught spray painting fruits in broad daylight.

headline: Old Video Used to Claim ‘US Accepts Quran’ to Fight COVID-19
fact_check_details: The video is from 2017 when Trump attended the inaugural prayer service after taking oath as the  President.

headline: Biryani Laced With Drugs for Hindus? No, Photos Are Unrelated
fact_check_details: The first picture could be found in a video which was posted by a channel called ‘Street Foodie Official’.

headline: Fake Posts Shared to Claim Justice Muralidhar Worked Under Cong MP
fact_check_details: Multiple posts have been  shared  to claim that Justice Muralidhar worked as Congress MP’s assistant.

headline: Hot Water Gargles Cure COVID-19? Claim Not Medically Corroborated
fact_check_details: There’s no medical proof that hot water gargles with salt/vinegar can treat the novel coronavirus.

headline: Case of Sexual Harassment From Ambala Shared With Communal Spin
fact_check_details: Ambala police officials confirmed that the accused is not a Muslim but one Pawan Kumar.

headline: UP Cleric Caught Pelting Stones During CAA Protests? Look Again!
fact_check_details: A message is being circulated on social media with a claim that a UP cleric was thrashed by cops for pelting stones.

headline: Delhi Violence: Fake Messages Claim DCP Amit Sharma Has Died
fact_check_details: Delhi Police PRO Anil Mittal told The Quint that his condition is stable and improving.

headline: Video  Claiming ‘Bullied Boy Quaden Bayles Killed Self’ is Fake
fact_check_details: A purported video ‘from BBC’ claims that bullied boy Quaden Bayles killed himself after bullying at school worsened.

headline: Old Protest Image Reshared Without Context Amid Anti-CAA Stir
fact_check_details: The image is from a protest which was organised in Kolkata but it is eight years old.

headline: Another Defunct Helpline No. For Women Safety Goes Viral
fact_check_details: The initiative was started by the Mumbai Police back in 8 March 2014 and was shut down on March 2017.

headline: Delhi Violence: No, These Photos Don’t Show Cops Beating Civilians
fact_check_details: The first image which shows a cop beating a boy is from Dhaka, while the other one is from Syria.

headline: Twitter is Testing Community Reporting  to Curb Misinformation
fact_check_details: The demo shows red or orange labels for tweets deemed as “harmfully misleading”.

headline: Republic Says Anti-CAA Protester Fired At Jamia, Facts Be Damned
fact_check_details: The shooter made his intentions clear through Facebook. Republic TV, however, had a different narrative.

headline: BJP MLA Upadhayay Didn't Condemn Beef Ban Because He Doesn't Exist
fact_check_details: The man in this video is a Kannada actor whose screen name is Sathyajith, and the real name is Syed Nizammudin.

headline: Delhi Mosque Vandalism Video Was Wrongly Labelled ‘Fake’ by Media
fact_check_details: The Quint visited the location to find out the facts and what had transpired in the afternoon of 25 February.

headline: 2 Cases of Coronavirus Confirmed in Kolkata? No, Media Misreported
fact_check_details: News agency PTI was among the first to report on these alleged cases of coronavirus in Kolkata.

headline: ‘Magic Blankets’ Given by AAP to Differently Abled? Fake Alert!
fact_check_details: The video is from Bijnor’s Seohara area & the blankets were not distributed by the AAP government.

headline: Hindu Women Beaten Up in Pak? No, Video is Unrelated & From Jammu
fact_check_details: A Twitter user shared the video with the claim that it shows the plight of Hindu women in Pakistan.

headline: COVID-19: Old Report Shared as Azim Premji Donating 50,000 Cr
fact_check_details: The donation actually came in March 2019 when the business tycoon had donated Rs 52,750 crores to charity.

headline: Did AMU Students Chant ‘Hinduon Ki Kabr Khudegi’? Fake News!
fact_check_details: In another video, users falsely claimed that students in Jamia University raised ‘Hinduon se aazadi’ slogans.

headline: Unrelated Videos Used to Show Coronavirus Patients Killed in China
fact_check_details: As per  France 24 Observer, a part of the video shows a  man hit in a motorcycle accident, not killed by police.

headline: Shaheen Bagh Empty Post AAP Win? Twitter Abuzz With False Report
fact_check_details: It’s unclear when the protesters will move from Shaheen Bagh, but as of today, they continue to raise their voice.

headline: Man in Civilian Clothes Is Delhi Cop, Not ABVP’s Bharat Sharma
fact_check_details: The Quint’s reporter has independently verified that the man seen in the image is constable Arvind Kumar.

headline: Delhi Violence Relief Video Used to Malign Shaheen Bagh Protests
fact_check_details: The Quint found out that the video is neither from Shaheen Bagh, nor were the women being paid to protest.

headline: How  TikTok Influencers Are Fuelling Fake News on COVID-19
fact_check_details: From meat-eating to hugging and propagating myths on the novel coronavirus, TikTok has become a hotbed of fake news.

headline: Jaipur Anti-Encroachment Drive Video Shared as Assam Police Action
fact_check_details: The video shows a tussle between Jaipur police and the residents of a colony against illegal encroachment.

headline: Video of a ‘Murder’ From WB Shared With a False Communal Claim
fact_check_details: The video is being widely shared on social media with the claim that ‘Hindutva goons’ are burying muslims.

headline: Viral Image of PM Modi’s Address With Lockdown Message Is Fake
fact_check_details: The viral image is a part of a presentation made by startup founders and sent to the prime minister’s office.

headline: RSS Member Impersonates Cop at Anti-CAA Protests? Nope, Look Again
fact_check_details: An image is being shared with the claim that an RSS member impersonated a cop during anti-CAA protest.

headline: No, Saudi Arabian Airlines Did Not Suspend its Flights to India
fact_check_details: “All flights to and from India are operating as per usual schedules,” a Saudi Arabian Airlines official confirmed.

headline: Jashodaben Protesting in Shaheen Bagh? Nope, Picture is Old
fact_check_details: This picture is  from 2016 where Jashodaben had joined members of an NGO on a day-long hunger strike in Mumbai.

headline: Old Incident From Bangladesh Passed off as Dalit Atrocity in Pune
fact_check_details: The boy was punished for harassing a ninth standard girl in Bangladesh following which he was garlanded with shoes.

headline: Old Video of BJP Lawmakers Fighting Shared as AAP Leaders’ Scuffle
fact_check_details: The video shows BJP lawmakers thrashing and abusing each other in Uttar Pradesh’s Sant Kabir Nagar.

headline: Chinese Converting To Islam To Prevent Coronavirus? Fake Alert!
fact_check_details: A viral video is being shared to claim that Chinese citizens are converting to Islam to prevent coronavirus.

headline: Old Video of UP Cops Hitting Pregnant Woman Shared Without Context
fact_check_details: The video is almost a year old and it shows police action against BEd and TET candidates who were protesting in UP.

headline: Old Image of Pakistanis Burning Tricolour Linked to CAA Protesters
fact_check_details: The image does not show CAA protesters. These protests actually took place in Pakistan’s Multan in June 2015.

headline: Video of UK Patient Shared as Pak Doctor’s Appeal Before Death
fact_check_details: The man in the video is not Pakistani Dr Usman Riaz but a UK resident named Mubashir Ahmed.

headline: From Jamia Arson to Coronavirus, Media Misreporting is a Menace
fact_check_details: What happens in a situation when the media starts publishing misinformation?

headline: Delhi Polls: Manoj Tiwari Used Deepfake to Reach Larger Voter Base
fact_check_details: Deepfake videos were circulated in 5,800 WhatsApp groups in Delhi-NCR, according to Vice.

headline: Javadekar Falsely Claims That No Bomb Blast Happened in Last 6 Yrs
fact_check_details: More than 1,000 explosion incidents were reported in many parts of the country over the last six years.

headline: Ankit Sharma Stabbed 12 Times, Not 400 – Post-Mortem Debunks Claim
fact_check_details: Home Minister Amit Shah and BJP MP Meenakshi Lekhi had also claimed that Sharma was stabbed 400 times.

headline: Fatah Shares Old Video as  Muslims Raising Communal Slurs in Delhi
fact_check_details: The video is actually from Rajasthan’s Udaipur and dates back to 2017.

headline: Daniel Radcliffe Tested Positive for Coronavirus? Here’s the Truth
fact_check_details: The fake account has now been suspended by Twitter for violating the rules.

headline: Fake AAP Candidate List for Delhi Polls Shared With Communal Angle
fact_check_details: According to the message, AAP has decided to field 21 Muslims out of 27 candidates in its first list.

headline: Pak Woman Yelled at Polio Workers? No, Tarek Fatah Gets It Wrong
fact_check_details: The video has been taken from a scene in Pakistani movie, Load Wedding which was released in 2018.

headline: BJP Used Clipped Video to Claim Scribe Calls for an Islamic State
fact_check_details: In the original clip, she says that protests should  “not be Muslim-only” and instead, should be inclusive.

headline: Poster at Priyanka’s Dharna Calls for a ‘Muslim India’? Fake Alert
fact_check_details: The slogan written on the poster actually read, “Lathi-goli nahi rozgaar-roti do.”

headline: Man Lashing Out at Judiciary on Camera is Not Justice Srikrishna
fact_check_details: The video of a man sharing his opinion on the Hyderabad vet rape-murder and the encounter has gone viral.

headline: No, Dr Devi Shetty Hasn’t Released an Audio Note on Coronavirus
fact_check_details: Speaking to The Quint, Dr Shetty denied releasing any such note and called the clip ‘fake’.

headline: Dead COVID-19 Patients in Italy? Pictures are Old & Unrelated
fact_check_details: The visuals are not related to the novel coronavirus pandemic in Italy; they are of different incidents and old.

headline: Ludhiana’s Free Ride Scheme for Women Shared as Maha’s, Kolkata’s
fact_check_details: One of the numbers  mentioned in the message is a pan-India number, while the other one is Ludhiana Police’s.

headline: Corpses of Wuhan Coronavirus Patients Dumped on Roads? Fake Alert
fact_check_details: A video on the internet is claiming that corpses of Wuhan coronavirus patients are being dumped on roads.

headline: Did Home Ministry Ban Official Use of ‘Hindu’?  Fake News Alert
fact_check_details: The fake order claims that MHA has directed all the states and UTs to avoid the term ‘Hindu’, ‘shiv ling’ etc.

headline: NHAI Exempting Lawyers From Paying Toll Tax? Letter is Fake!

headline: Swedish Child Beaten by Muslim Immigrants? No, It’s False News

headline: Old Video of Attack on BJP’s Dilip Ghosh Revived Amid CAA Protests
fact_check_details: The video is from 2017 when Ghosh, along with other BJP leaders, was attacked by Gorkha supporters in Darjeeling.

headline: Ronaldo Isn’t Turning Hotels to Hospitals for Coronavirus Patients

headline: Land Dispute Shared as Communal Attack on B’desh ISKCON Temple
fact_check_details: We got in touch with the management of ISKCON and the police who said that the incident was a property dispute.

headline: Did Belgium Health Minister Ban 'Group Sex' Over COVID-19? Nope!
fact_check_details: World News Daily Report produces articles that are ‘satirical’ and ‘fictional’ in nature.

headline: Meenakshi Lekhi’s Claim About ‘No Riots in Guj Post 2002’ is False
fact_check_details: The data collected by the NCRB paints a different picture and shows the  cases of violence/riots post 2002.

headline: CAA Protests: Class 12 Student Misidentified as Jamia’s Ayesha

headline: Fake Tweet Used to Claim Shehla Rashid Asked to Boycott Shikara
fact_check_details: Speaking to The Quint, Shehla Rashid said that the tweet is fake and that she has not made any such appeal.

headline: Cong Divided India on Basis of Religion, Says Shah – But Did It?
fact_check_details: While blaming the Congress for partition based on religion, Amit Shah might be overlooking history and facts.

headline: COVID-19: Fake Bulletin Used to Claim PM Ordered Internet Shutdown
fact_check_details: The viral images differ from the actual bulletins in terms of formatting, content and language.

headline: ‘Blind’ Singers’ Video Sees Million Views, But the Claim Is Fake
fact_check_details: The video went viral in 2017 too, but Aabhas Joshi, who features in the video, told us that the claim is false.

headline: Turmeric and Lemon Help Fight Coronavirus? Doctors Say No Proof

headline: Photo of People Who Died of Coronavirus? No, It’s an Art Project!
fact_check_details: Along with the photo, a message is also being shared which lays out warnings against the deadly coronavirus.

headline: Did Umar Khalid Chant ‘Hinduon Se Azadi’? BJP Makes False Claim

headline: Gambhir Uses Defunct School to Target AAP on Education Front

headline: IPS Officer Stepping On Jamia Student? No, Image Is From Lucknow
fact_check_details: An old image of a cop trampling a protester with boots is viral on social media with a claim that it is from Jamia.

headline: AAP Providing Relief Aid to Only Muslims? Newspaper Ad is Edited

headline: ‘Magically Healed in a Day’: ABVP’s Fake Claim About JNU’s Soori

headline: No, Kanika Kapoor Did Not Infect Prince Charles With COVID-19
fact_check_details: The image is from 2015 when Kanika Kapoor attended an event hosted by Prince Charles Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall.

headline: Muslims Rejoicing the Quran Ban Being Lifted in China? Fake Alert!
fact_check_details: The video is as old as 2014 and purportedly shows Chinese Christians crying as they receive Bibles.

headline: Why CAA Protesters With Fake Bandages Don’t Mean Fake Injuries
fact_check_details: Yes, these bandages are fake – but that doesn’t mean the protesters are faking injuries, as claimed. Here’s why.

headline: Old Video of Chinese Prez at Mosque Revived Amid Coronavirus Scare
fact_check_details: In the video, Xi Jinping can be seen in a mosque, interacting with some men and shaking their hands.

headline: Are Supriya Sule & Bal Thackeray Related? No, Just a Viral Hoax
fact_check_details: Sadanand Sule’s mother was Shashi Bhatt who passed away in 1964 when he was just two years old.

headline: Fake! RSS Mag Says Christian School Punished Boy For Ayyappa Dress

headline: COVID-19 Misinformation Is Keeping Fact-Checkers on Their Toes
fact_check_details: IFCN, comprising of fact-checkers across the globe, has debunked over 1,000 claims made about the novel coronavirus.

headline: Bodies of COVID-19 Victims Being Dumped in Italy? No, a Film Scene
fact_check_details: The visuals are actually from a TV series about a (fictional) deadly bird flu in Los Angeles that aired in 2007.

headline: Muslims Threw Meat Near Hindu Temple? No, They’re Rooster Feathers
fact_check_details: The Hathras Police found that the things lying on the ground are feathers of a rooster.

headline: ‘Still Worth Listening To’: Kiran Bedi On Sharing False NASA Video
fact_check_details: Kiran Bedi shared a video claiming NASA released the sound the Sun makes, and it was ‘Om’. That’s not really true.

headline: Akhilesh Govt Paid Bollywood Celebs for Positive Comments? No
fact_check_details: The viral message claims that Adityanath had stopped the monthly money that Bollywood celebrities were getting.

headline: Ramdev Infected With Coronavirus? No, Image Is Old & Unrelated
fact_check_details: The picture was taken in Dehradun in 2011, after the yoga guru broke his nine-day fast.

headline: Hoax Website Claims China Planning to Kill Coronavirus Patients
fact_check_details: Many other articles published by AB-TC (aka City News) have been debunked by various fact-checkers multiple times.

headline: Did Amanatullah Khan Say ‘We Will Become Sharia’? No, Listen Again
fact_check_details: The clip of Amanatullah Khan is being shared with people claiming that he said “Hum Sharia banenge” in the video.

headline: MP Video of Mob Beating Farmers Viral As ‘RSS Atrocity’ in Delhi
fact_check_details: One farmer died while five others were injured by a mob amid rumours that a gang of child-lifters was present.

headline: VHP Leader’s Video Used to Claim Naseeruddin Shah’s Kin Is Pro-CAA
fact_check_details: He is VHP Leader Acharya Dharmendra and not Naseeruddin Shah’s brother Rizwan Ahmed.

headline: Accused in Hyderabad Case Being Roughed Up? No, Video is From AP

headline: No Hindus Accused in Hyd Rape Case? UP ‘Priest’ Spreads Fake News
fact_check_details: Narsinghanand Saraswati, head priest of a temple in UP, has spread communal hatred at various occasions in the past.

headline: Did JNUSU Prez Aishe Ghosh Fake Injury? No, It’s a Mirror Image
fact_check_details: The image in which it can be seen in her right hand is actually a mirror image of the original one.

headline: No, Barack & Michelle Obama Aren’t Divorcing; Article is a Parody
fact_check_details: A news article about  Barack Obama and Michelle Obama announcing divorce is being shared on social media.

headline: Case From MP Shared as Girl Found Dead in Tahir Hussain’s House
fact_check_details: The image is of 18-year-old Jyoti Patidar who allegedly killed herself on  20 February in Madhya Pradesh.

headline: Video of Woman Beaten in Pak Shared as Atrocity Against Hindus
fact_check_details: Her name is Amrat Shahzadi and the incident took place when a fight happened between lawyers and the woman.

headline: Russia Using Lions to Make People Stay Indoors? No, it’s Fake News
fact_check_details: It has been created using a template ‘Break you own news,’ and is not a part of any bulletin run by a media outlet.

headline: Places Most Affected by COVID-19 Situated At Latitude 40°? No
fact_check_details: Coordinates of certain places mentioned in the viral message go as far as  47 and 48° N.

headline: Docs Say No Data to Claim Tea Can Cure COVID-19, It’s a Fake Msg
fact_check_details: Dr Suranjit Chatterjee, Apollo Hospitals, said that there is no evidence to support the claim.

headline: Old Video of Guns in Cans Shared as RSS Distributing Arms in Delhi
fact_check_details: The video dates back to September 2019 when Delhi Police Special Cell had arrested two people from Ghazipur area.

headline: Unverified Message Claims Israel Has Found the Cure For COVID-19
fact_check_details: Contrary to the claims there is no medical evidence to suggest that lemon & baking soda can help cure coronavirus.

headline: No pH Value of COVID-19, Experts Deny Its Link With Alkaline Food
fact_check_details: Dr Shaheed Jameel, a leading virologist told The Quint that viruses do not have pH values.

headline: China Govt Killing Pigs Over Fear of Coronavirus? No, Video is Old
fact_check_details: The rather graphic video shows a large number of pigs  in a pit being burned alive.

headline: Film Scene Shared as Mass Graves in Italy Due to COVID-19 Deaths
fact_check_details: The image is taken from a 2011 film ‘Contagion’ directed by Steven Soderbergh.

headline: Did Saddam Say US Threatened Iraq With Coronavirus in 1990s? No!
fact_check_details: The viral video is a doctored version of the original video shared by Associated Press in 2015.

headline: This is Not Corona-Hit Italy, the Photos are of Croatia Earthquake
fact_check_details: Many have shared these photos on social media claiming that they show the havoc coronavirus has wreaked in Italy.

headline: Old Video of Delhi’s Inderlok Passed off as Situation ‘Right Now’

headline: COVID-19: Morphed Image Used to Claim ‘Wilson’ Gifted to Tom Hanks

headline: Doctored Screenshots Claim China’s Coronavirus Deaths Over 24,000
fact_check_details: There have been claims that a data leak by website Tencent shows that deaths due to coronavirus have crossed 24,000.

headline: Audio on COVID-19 ‘Cure’ Falsely Linked to Medanta Hospital’s MD

headline: Taj Mahal Being Cleaned Just Before Trump’s Visit? No, It’s Fake
fact_check_details: The video is of a Taj-Mahal like structure in People’s Mall in Bhopal.

headline: Girl Made DSP for a Day Used to Show Muslim SP Didn't Wear Uniform

headline: Fictitious MLA Anil Upadhyay Revived Over Gandhi Effigy Shooting

headline: God Punishes Man for Blasphemy? Well, Images are Unrelated

headline: Hindu Women Masquerade as Muslims at CAA Protests? No, Fake Claim!
fact_check_details: The message claims that two burqa-clad women were shouting pro-Pakistan slogans at the anti-CAA protest in Lucknow.

headline: Fake Claims Of Cops Seizing Dog Meat at Bihar Railway Stn Go Viral
fact_check_details: An image of cops seizing dog meat at a railway station is doing the rounds on social media with misleading claims.
